title: Arpeggio: Minor 6th in A# (Shape: C)
content:
# Arpeggio: Minor 6th in A# (Shape: C)

## Brief Presentation
An arpeggio is the playing of the notes of a chord in sequence, rather than simultaneously. The Minor 6th arpeggio in A# consists of the notes A#, C#, E#, and F#. This arpeggio is played using the C shape on the guitar.

## Notes and Intervals
- Root (A#)
- Minor 3rd (C#)
- Perfect 5th (E#)
- Minor 6th (F#)

## Musical Flavor and Genre
The Minor 6th arpeggio adds a melancholic yet emotive flavor to music. It is often used in genres such as jazz, blues, and classical music to create tension or add a bittersweet quality to the sound.

## Songs
Three songs that use the Minor 6th arpeggio in A# (Shape: C) are:
1. "Autumn Leaves" by Joseph Kosma
2. "All Blues" by Miles Davis
3. "Clair de Lune" by Claude Debussy
